member.name: M:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.OperationsResource.Cancel(Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.CancelOperationRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Clients can use Operations.GetOperation or other methods to check whether the cancellation succeeded or whether the operation completed despite cancellation. On successful cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with an Operation.error value with a google.rpc.Status.code of 1, corresponding to `Code.CANCELLED`.
member.param: The name of the operation resource to be cancelled.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.OperationsResource.CancelRequest
member.summary: Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Clients can use Operations.GetOperation or other methods to check whether the cancellation succeeded or whether the operation completed despite cancellation. On successful cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with an Operation.error value with a google.rpc.Status.code of 1, corresponding to `Code.CANCELLED`.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.VoicesResource.service
member.summary: The service which this resource belongs to.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.VoicesResource.List
member.summary: Returns a list of Voice supported for synthesis.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.VoicesResource.ListRequest
member.summary: Returns a list of Voice supported for synthesis.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.VoicesResource.ListRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary: Optional. Recommended. [BCP-47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) language tag. If not specified, the API will return all supported voices. If specified, the ListVoices call will only return voices that can be used to synthesize this language_code. For example, if you specify `"en-NZ"`, all `"en-NZ"` voices will be returned. If you specify `"no"`, both `"no-\*"` (Norwegian) and `"nb-\*"` (Norwegian Bokmal) voices will be returned.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.AudioConfig
member.summary: Description of audio data to be synthesized.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.AudioConfig.AudioEncoding
member.summary: Required. The format of the audio byte stream.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.AudioConfig.EffectsProfileId
member.summary: Optional. Input only. An identifier which selects 'audio effects' profiles that are applied on (post synthesized) text to speech. Effects are applied on top of each other in the order they are given. See [audio profiles](https://cloud.google.com/text-to-speech/docs/audio-profiles) for current supported profile ids.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.AudioConfig.Pitch
member.summary: Optional. Input only. Speaking pitch, in the range [-20.0, 20.0]. 20 means increase 20 semitones from the original pitch. -20 means decrease 20 semitones from the original pitch.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.AudioConfig.SampleRateHertz
member.summary: Optional. The synthesis sample rate (in hertz) for this audio. When this is specified in SynthesizeSpeechRequest, if this is different from the voice's natural sample rate, then the synthesizer will honor this request by converting to the desired sample rate (which might result in worse audio quality), unless the specified sample rate is not supported for the encoding chosen, in which case it will fail the request and return google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.AudioConfig.SpeakingRate
member.summary: Optional. Input only. Speaking rate/speed, in the range [0.25, 4.0]. 1.0 is the normal native speed supported by the specific voice. 2.0 is twice as fast, and 0.5 is half as fast. If unset(0.0), defaults to the native 1.0 speed. Any other values < 0.25 or > 4.0 will return an error.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.AudioConfig.VolumeGainDb
member.summary: Optional. Input only. Volume gain (in dB) of the normal native volume supported by the specific voice, in the range [-96.0, 16.0]. If unset, or set to a value of 0.0 (dB), will play at normal native signal amplitude. A value of -6.0 (dB) will play at approximately half the amplitude of the normal native signal amplitude. A value of +6.0 (dB) will play at approximately twice the amplitude of the normal native signal amplitude. Strongly recommend not to exceed +10 (dB) as there's usually no effective increase in loudness for any value greater than that.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.CustomVoiceParams
member.summary: Description of the custom voice to be synthesized.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.CustomVoiceParams.Model
member.summary: Required. The name of the AutoML model that synthesizes the custom voice.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.CustomVoiceParams.ReportedUsage
member.summary: Optional. Deprecated. The usage of the synthesized audio to be reported.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Empty
T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.GoogleCloudTexttospeechV1SynthesizeLongAudioMetadata
member.summary: Metadata for response returned by the `SynthesizeLongAudio` method.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.GoogleCloudTexttospeechV1SynthesizeLongAudioMetadata.ProgressPercentage
member.summary: The progress of the most recent processing update in percentage, ie. 70.0%.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.GoogleCloudTexttospeechV1SynthesizeLongAudioMetadata.StartTimeRaw
member.summary: Time when the request was received.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.ListOperationsResponse.Operations
member.summary: A list of operations that matches the specified filter in the request.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.ListVoicesResponse
member.summary: The message returned to the client by the `ListVoices` method.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Operation
member.summary: This resource represents a long-running operation that is the result of a network API call.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Operation.Done
member.summary: If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress. If `true`, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is available.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Operation.Error
member.summary: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Operation.Metadata
member.summary: Service-specific metadata associated with the operation. It typically contains progress information and common metadata such as create time. Some services might not provide such metadata. Any method that returns a long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Operation.Name
member.summary: The server-assigned name, which is only unique within the same service that originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the `name` should be a resource name ending with `operations/{unique_id}`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Operation.Response
member.summary: The normal, successful response of the operation. If the original method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is `google.protobuf.Empty`. If the original method is standard `Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource. For other methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx` is the original method name. For example, if the original method name is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is `TakeSnapshotResponse`.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Status
member.summary: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Status.Code
member.summary: The status code, which should be an enum value of google.rpc.Code.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Status.Details
member.summary: A list of messages that carry the error details. There is a common set of message types for APIs to use.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Status.Message
member.summary: A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the google.rpc.Status.details field, or localized by the client.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesisInput
member.summary: Contains text input to be synthesized. Either `text` or `ssml` must be supplied. Supplying both or neither returns google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT. The input size is limited to 5000 bytes.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesisInput.Ssml
member.summary: The SSML document to be synthesized. The SSML document must be valid and well-formed. Otherwise the RPC will fail and return google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT. For more information, see [SSML](https://cloud.google.com/text-to-speech/docs/ssml).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesisInput.Text
member.summary: The raw text to be synthesized.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeLongAudioMetadata
member.summary: Metadata for response returned by the `SynthesizeLongAudio` method.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeLongAudioMetadata.ProgressPercentage
member.summary: The progress of the most recent processing update in percentage, ie. 70.0%.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeLongAudioMetadata.StartTimeRaw
member.summary: Time when the request was received.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeLongAudioRequest
member.summary: The top-level message sent by the client for the `SynthesizeLongAudio` method.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeLongAudioRequest.AudioConfig
member.summary: Required. The configuration of the synthesized audio.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeLongAudioRequest.Input
member.summary: Required. The Synthesizer requires either plain text or SSML as input. While Long Audio is in preview, SSML is temporarily unsupported.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeLongAudioRequest.OutputGcsUri
member.summary: Required. Specifies a Cloud Storage URI for the synthesis results. Must be specified in the format: `gs://bucket_name/object_name`, and the bucket must already exist.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeLongAudioRequest.Voice
member.summary: Required. The desired voice of the synthesized audio.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeSpeechRequest
member.summary: The top-level message sent by the client for the `SynthesizeSpeech` method.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.AudioConfig
member.summary: Required. The configuration of the synthesized audio.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.Input
member.summary: Required. The Synthesizer requires either plain text or SSML as input.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.Voice
member.summary: Required. The desired voice of the synthesized audio.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeSpeechResponse
member.summary: The message returned to the client by the `SynthesizeSpeech` method.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.SynthesizeSpeechResponse.AudioContent
member.summary: The audio data bytes encoded as specified in the request, including the header for encodings that are wrapped in containers (e.g. MP3, OGG_OPUS). For LINEAR16 audio, we include the WAV header. Note: as with all bytes fields, protobuffers use a pure binary representation, whereas JSON representations use base64.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Voice
member.summary: Description of a voice supported by the TTS service.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Voice.LanguageCodes
member.summary: The languages that this voice supports, expressed as [BCP-47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) language tags (e.g. "en-US", "es-419", "cmn-tw").

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Voice.Name
member.summary: The name of this voice. Each distinct voice has a unique name.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.Voice.NaturalSampleRateHertz
member.summary: The natural sample rate (in hertz) for this voice.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.VoiceSelectionParams
member.summary: Description of which voice to use for a synthesis request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.VoiceSelectionParams.CustomVoice
member.summary: The configuration for a custom voice. If [CustomVoiceParams.model] is set, the service will choose the custom voice matching the specified configuration.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.VoiceSelectionParams.LanguageCode
member.summary: Required. The language (and potentially also the region) of the voice expressed as a [BCP-47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) language tag, e.g. "en-US". This should not include a script tag (e.g. use "cmn-cn" rather than "cmn-Hant-cn"), because the script will be inferred from the input provided in the SynthesisInput. The TTS service will use this parameter to help choose an appropriate voice. Note that the TTS service may choose a voice with a slightly different language code than the one selected; it may substitute a different region (e.g. using en-US rather than en-CA if there isn't a Canadian voice available), or even a different language, e.g. using "nb" (Norwegian Bokmal) instead of "no" (Norwegian)".

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.VoiceSelectionParams.Name
member.summary: The name of the voice. If not set, the service will choose a voice based on the other parameters such as language_code and gender.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Texttospeech.v1.Data.VoiceSelectionParams.SsmlGender
member.summary: The preferred gender of the voice. If not set, the service will choose a voice based on the other parameters such as language_code and name. Note that this is only a preference, not requirement; if a voice of the appropriate gender is not available, the synthesizer should substitute a voice with a different gender rather than failing the request.
